content.text: The admissions process is the first point of contact between prospective families and the school community, establishing trust, transparency, and shared commitment to student success.

content.title: Key Objectives of Admissions Policy
items: Equitable access to enrollment for every child who can benefit from our Cambridge international education.
Clear understanding of educational philosophy, expectations, and support systems for families.
Maintenance of appropriate class sizes and teacher-student ratios.
Placement of students in environments where they can thrive academically, socially, and emotionally.
Compliance with Indonesian regulations and international accreditation standards.

content.title: Commitment to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion
items: No discrimination based on religion, ethnicity, gender, socioeconomic status, or learning differences.
Holistic consideration of each applicant's potential.
Reasonable accommodations for students with Special Educational Needs (SEN).
Support for English as an Additional Language (EAL) learners.

steps.title: Inquiry & Tour
steps.desc: Prospective families visit the school, meet admissions staff, and tour the facilities.

steps.title: Application
steps.desc: Submission of application form, previous school records, and required documents.

steps.title: Assessment
steps.desc: Entrance tests in English, Mathematics, and Science (for relevant grades) and a student interview.

steps.title: Decision
steps.desc: The Admissions Committee reviews the file and communicates the decision (Acceptance, Waitlist, or Decline).

steps.title: Registration
steps.desc: Payment of fees and signing of the enrollment contract.

content.title: Required Documents for Enrollment
items: Passport and residence permit (for international students)

content.text: The school offers a limited number of scholarships to recognize excellence and support access.

rows: Outstanding performance on entrance exams and previous academic records.
Demonstrated excellence in sports, arts, or other co-curricular areas.
Need-based support for families demonstrating financial hardship.

content.text: All marketing materials must accurately reflect the school's vision, mission, and programs. Use of the Eduversal and Cambridge logos must adhere strictly to brand guidelines.

content.label: Social Media
content.text: Official school accounts must be managed professionally. Student photos require parental consent before posting.
